Notes.Text:
This update for zabbix fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2024-42333: Fixed buffer over-read for broken UTF8 mail data injection. (bsc#1233834)
- CVE-2024-22117: Fixed a bug that can cause the map element to crash when new URLs are added. (bsc#1233791)
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server LTSS Extended Security 12 SP5

Vulnerabilities.Description: When a URL is added to the map element, it is recorded in the database with sequential IDs. Upon adding a new URL, the system retrieves the last sysmapelementurlid value and increments it by one. However, an issue arises when a user manually changes the sysmapelementurlid value by adding sysmapelementurlid + 1. This action prevents others from adding URLs to the map element.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server LTSS Extended Security 12 SP5:zabbix-agent-4.0.12-4.32.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: The researcher is showing that it is possible to leak a small amount of Zabbix Server memory using an out of bounds read in src/libs/zbxmedia/email.c

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server LTSS Extended Security 12 SP5:zabbix-agent-4.0.12-4.32.1
